title: Official Blind Review #3
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I assessed the sensibility of the derivations and theory.
review:
The paper applies CNN architectures and wavelet decomposition of some moderate-dimensional EEG signals from a recent EEG-BCI competition with the aim of using representational compactness to increase classification efficiency while retaining computational efficiency. The motivation is good and the position in the (vast) EEG-BCI literature is appropriate.
However, I see neither a convincing case for computational efficiency (it is still a net requiring large training as opposed to simpler frequency binning / generalized svd methods), nor a convincing case for a classification accuracy breakthrough (results are similar to many other known methods). Furthermore the pictures showing 'activation' patterns are not necessarily revealing nor are they convincingly artifact - filtering. Overall the decision is to reject based on insufficient significance and impact of result - although the paper is otherwise fairly well written and organized.
